title: Condensed Deco Typeface
content:
Trying to ID the deco condensed sans typeface used for "Beverly James & Phillip Barnes". Thanks in advance!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317185453im_/http:/typophile.com/files/maemae_beverly25_5100.jpg)

Font: 

 Frisco Bay JNL 

Solved By: 

 [DPape](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317185453/http:/typophile.com/user/3945 "View user profile.")

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [maemae\_beverly25.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317185453/http:/typophile.com/files/maemae_beverly25.jpg) | 841.88 KB |
author: abraatz

comments.content:
Both Nocturne and Frisco Bay JNL are based on the same 1920s Art Deco source -- sometimes called Jason -- but Frisco Bay JNL is closer to the invitation. Working link [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/jnlevine/frisco-bay/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317185453/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/jnlevine/frisco-bay/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/jnlevine/frisco-bay/")  
Don
